page.title: 01SURVEY AREA, PEMBROKE.
page.content: The survey area is immediately to the south,south-east and south-west of the town of{Pembroke.}It contains part of the village of{Hundleton}and the hamlet of{Maiden Wells,}but consists almost entirely of farmland. This area,of the new county of{Dyfed, is partiularly beautiful and has a large influx of tourists during the summer season.To the south,east and west are many well used beaches and areas of scenic beauty,and to the north is{Pembroke,}dominated by its very fine Norman castle. The area has been surveyed by the fourth year pupils of{Priory Junior {School,Monkton,Pembroke;}which is situated just to the north of the survey area.
